gettingStarted.title: 1. Getting Started
gettingStarted.desc: Create your workspace, confirm your email, and validate your setup before going live.
steps: Confirm your email to activate your account.
Complete your business profile in Business settings.
Open the Widget page to get your embed script.
Test the widget on your site and send a message.
gettingStarted.screenshot: Screenshot placeholder: Business profile and dashboard overview.

installWidget.title: 2. Install the Widget
installWidget.desc: Add the script to your website and verify that the widget appears and replies.
steps: Copy the embed script from Dashboard → Widget.
Paste it before the closing </body> tag on your site.
Publish the changes and refresh your site.
Open a conversation to verify messages arrive.
troubleshooting: Make sure the script is loaded on every page you want to support.
Disable ad blockers for a quick test.
Confirm your domain is allowed in Widget settings.
installWidget.screenshot: Screenshot placeholder: Widget settings with embed key.

customize.title: 3. Customize the Assistant
customize.desc: Make the assistant sound like your brand and answer accurately.
bullets: Update your business knowledge: services, policies, hours, and FAQs.
Set tone and instructions in Assistant settings.
Choose a default language and test with real questions.
Enable lead capture and notifications if you want follow‑ups.
customize.screenshot: Screenshot placeholder: Assistant settings + knowledge base.

q1.a: Aliigo is an AI assistant that lives on your website. It answers visitor questions and turns conversations into qualified leads.

section2.title: 2. Data we collect
section2.content:
Depending on how you use the Website or Service, we may collect:
- Account data: name, email, password hash (not your raw password), business name, and optional phone/website
- Billing data: subscription status and payment metadata (payments are handled by our payment processor)

- Technical data: log data and device/browser information (e.g., IP address, timestamps, user agent) for security and reliability
- Analytics/marketing data (only when enabled via consent where required)

section3.title: 3. Purposes and legal bases
section3.content:
We process data for:
A) Providing the Service and operating your account (contract)
B) Billing, payments, fraud prevention, and account administration (contract / legitimate interests)
C) Security, abuse prevention, debugging, and service improvement (legitimate interests)
D) Customer support and service communications (contract / legitimate interests)
E) Analytics and measurement (consent where required)
F) Marketing (consent where required)
We do not sell personal data.

section4.title: 4. Sharing and recipients
section4.content:
We share data with vendors (processors) only as needed to provide the Service, including:
- Hosting and infrastructure: Vercel
- Security/CDN: Cloudflare
- Database and authentication: Supabase
- Transactional email: Resend
- Payments and billing: Stripe
- AI processing to generate responses: OpenAI
- Microsoft Clarity — session analytics and heatmaps
We may also use analytics and advertising tools (e.g., Google Analytics 4 via Google Tag Manager; Meta Pixel). Depending on configuration, these providers may act as processors or independent controllers.
For transparency and updates, see our “Subprocessors & Third‑Party Services” page.

Depending on your location, you may have rights to access, rectify, erase, restrict, object, and port your personal data. To exercise rights, contact legal@aliigo.com.
If you are in Spain, you may also lodge a complaint with the Spanish Data Protection Authority (AEPD).

C) Analytics cookies (optional): measure usage and improve the product (e.g., Google Analytics 4, Microsoft Clarity).
D) Marketing cookies (optional): measure ad performance and build audiences (e.g., Meta Pixel).

section3.title: 3. Typical cookie identifiers (examples)
section3.content:

- Microsoft Clarity: _clck, _clsk (names and durations can vary)
- Meta: _fbp
- Cloudflare: __cf_bm and similar security cookies
These examples may change as vendors update their systems.

section4.content: Where required by law (e.g., in Spain/EU), analytics and marketing cookies are disabled by default until you opt in. You can change your choices anytime via the cookie settings banner (if enabled) or your browser settings.
